_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

Performance Foodservice - Batesville



Risk Management Plan Executive Summary



General Executive Summary:



1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:

The Performance Foodservice - Batesville facility is committed to managing its operations in a manner that protects the environment and the health and safety of employees, contractors and the public. There is one process at the facility that is subject to the RMP requirements, the refrigeration system, due to its use of anhydrous ammonia.  The system is designed with appropriate controls to prevent foreseeable accidental releases. In the event a release does occur, the facility would be coordinated with the Batesville Fire Department which provides our emergency response services.



2. The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled:

Performance Foodservice - Batesville utilizes an anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system to keep products at temperature and preserve food safety standards. Anhydrous ammonia is the only regulated substance present at Performance Foodservice - Batesville. The maximum intended inventory of anhydrous ammonia that is expected to be present in this system is 11,137 pounds.



3. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:

Performance Foodservice - Batesville has taken the following steps as required by 40 CFR Part 68 of the EPA, and the OSHA PSM Standard under 29 CFR 1910.119. Performance Foodservice - Batesville is also subject to EPCRA Section 302 reporting requirements. The following sections briefly describe the elements of the release prevention program that is in place.



Process Safety Information:

Performance Foodservice - Batesville keeps Process Safety Information (PSI) documentation for the ammonia refrigeration system. This PSI assists the employee operators and outside contractors in understanding the ammonia refrigeration system so they can operate and maintain the amm

onia refrigeration system in a safe and efficient manner. PSI is available to all employees.



Process Hazard Analysis:

Our facility conducts periodic assessments to ensure that hazards associated with our process are identified and controlled. The methodology used to carry out these analyses is the What if/Checklist method. These assessments are undertaken by a team of personnel with experience in the process and operations, and these assessments are revalidated at a regular interval of every five years. The process hazard analysis would also be revalidated if there were an extensive change in the process. 





4. 5-Year Accident History:

This facility has not had any accidental releases from covered processes that have resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage during the past 5 years.



5. Emergency Response Plan:

Performance Foodservice - Batesville has a written emergency action plan to deal with accidental releases of hazardous materials. The emergency action plan includes specific actions to be taken in response to accidental releases of regulated substances. The emergency action plan includes procedures for informing the public and local response agencies of a chemical release. Performance Foodservice - Batesville works closely with the Batesville Fire Department for response to emergency situations including releases of anhydrous ammonia.



6. Planned Changes to Improve Safety:

The facility has conducted and intends to continue periodic facility evacuation drills and planning/training site visits with Batesville Fire Department.
